data.name: Magic Highschool: Sorting spell
data.description:
It's been one week you've been in the **Magic Highschool**, and your magic spell teacher found out that you and your friend's bedrooms were a mess.
Later that day, she decided to teach you a new, sorting spell: *onarij-ar* **\[to make it clean\]**. No more messy bedrooms!

This spell, like many others, comes in a lot of varieties; for instance, to sort objects by color, the spell will be *onarij-ar inarij* **\[to make it clean colorwise\]**. If you want them to be ordered by color and then by name, simply say *onarij-ar inarij yaxan-ij* **\[to make it clean colorwise and by name\]**.

Your task will be to code such a sorting algorithm on your [magical computer](http://www.scp-wiki.net/scp-079).
The spell and its varieties all begin with `onarij-ar`, and are then followed by modifiers separated by spaces (there will be no conflict between modifiers):

* `inarij` **\[colored/colorwise\]**: sort by color (think wavelength): first purple, then blue, green, yellow, orange, red and lastly colorless
* `yaxan-ij` **\[by name\]**: sort by name, alphabetically
* `niùn-ij` **\[by type\]**: sort by type, alphabetically
* `onij` **\[big\]**: sort by size, from smallest to biggest

Your algorithm will look at the first modifier, and sort it according to it.
Should there be items sharing the same spot, the algorithm should then refer to the next modifier.
As such, *onarij-ar niùn onij* means that you have sort the items by their type and then by their size.

Objects will have the following structure:

```javascript
{
  color: "red", // may otherwise be "purple", ..., "colorless"
  name: "object's name",
  type: "type",
  size: 32 // in centimeters
}
```

Your function will be named `execute_spell` and will receive as arguments the `spell` and the `objects`.

If there are no objects in the room, return an empty array. Additionally, if the spell does not include any modifier or isn't `onarij-ar`, return the untouched array.
